metadata.Name: RuCoLA
metadata.Description: Russian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability for benchmarking linguistic competence of language models
Provider: Center for Information and Language Processing (CIS)
metadata.Paper Title: RuCoLA: Russian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability
metadata.Venue Name: The 2022 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
Affiliations: Center for Information and Language Processing (CIS), LMU Munich
metadata.Abstract: This paper introduces RuCoLA, a novel benchmark of 13.4k sentences labeled as acceptable or not, for assessing the linguistic competence of language models for Russian. The dataset combines in-domain sentences manually collected from linguistic literature and out-of-domain sentences produced by nine machine translation and paraphrase generation models. The paper describes the data collection protocol and presents a fine-grained analysis of acceptability classification experiments with a range of baseline approaches.
